content.description: This route is on the back side of the Evolution Boulder, and also serves as the downclimb of Evolution Face and Kneelock. This route is very easy throughout.
content.protection: Crash pad, although it may not be needed.
content.location: On the back side of Evolution Face

content.description: To the left of Evolution Face, there is a problem that could be climbed by me, but I'm not quite strong enough yet. There is a terrible landing, as you will fall onto a rock and break your back if you fall in the wrong spot. It starts out pretty easy. You start at the very left side of the lower boulder. The rocks to the left of this boulder are off. IT is easy to stay on this boulder, for you can lock your knees into a space under the upper boulder. After that, it gets harder. Do a very short traverse until you are right over a rock on the ground. Climb up the cruxy face, making sure that if you fall, you push away from the rock so you land safely instead of the rock on the ground.
content.location: On the same boulder as Evolution Face

content.description:
The clean dual boulder stack that may have been climbed before, but any info about this problem is unknown. There is a short trail around the back of it.

After countless attempts, I finally managed to send it.
content.location: Down the trail about 0.3 miles. The boulder is behind a sign talking about the evolution of a landscape. You can't miss this boulder.
